definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: So I'm going to stay away from you for a few days."
sentences.chinese: 因此我要和你分开一段时间。”

sentences.english: Young scene seize turned separate yeongjo, want to notice him about plucking exceedingly senti-mental secrets.
sentences.chinese: 幼景抓住转身分开的英祖，要通知他关于寒星的机密。

sentences.english: I knew that. The pointees are separate.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，指针数据是分开的。

sentences.english: Indeed, pain and itch have been difficult to separate.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，疼痛和瘙痒一直以来都很难分开。

sentences.english: Well, how can you tell the one from the other?
sentences.chinese: 那么你怎么把它们分开呢？

sentences.english: Spare parts shall be packed separately from the vessels.
sentences.chinese: 备件应同容器分开包装。

sentences.english: Here in L.A., installation is charged separately.
sentences.chinese: 在洛杉矶，安装费都是分开来收取的。

sentences.english: And now you get separation on the order of centimeters.
sentences.chinese: 现在可能分开到厘米的程度。

sentences.english: She left the office with tears in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她眼里含着泪，分开了办公室。

sentences.english: They're kept away from other chemicals.
sentences.chinese: 它们与其它化学药品分开贮藏。

sentences.english: They look too contrived--and buying separates is much more affordable.
sentences.chinese: 因为套装看上去太做作，分开买更实惠些。

sentences.english: Some of these atoms combine with separate oxygen molecules to form ozone.
sentences.chinese: 一些原子由于分开的氧分子联合形成新鲜的空气。

sentences.english: Templates and foundation bolting shall be shipped separately from the vessels according to Purchaser's instruction.
sentences.chinese: 样板及地脚螺栓应根据买方指导同容器分开运输。

sentences.english: Squat with your feet a little less than shoulder distance apart.
I have no feelings whatsoever when were apart.
sentences.chinese: 当我们分开的时候，我心如止水。

sentences.english: The cell at the top is at prophase, showing the condensing chromosomes prior to their separation.
sentences.chinese: 上面的细胞处于分裂前期，凝集的染色体将要分开。

definition: to become reconciled/on good terms with each other
two (colloquial equivalent of 兩個|两个)/both/some
(of people who were estranged) to be reconciled/(of a couple) to get back together
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
